Contaminated Site Description: Norman Wells Island, Bear Island, Bear Island Pipeline Terminal 2 (GPS location coordinates included).
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: Environmental assessment work is currently in progress (soil, groundwater, and surface water sampling) with the objective of understanding any potential risk to receptors and delineating the extent of the released material. Currently available data does not show a risk to the surface water body to the east. The need for clean-up work to mitigate environmental risk will be determined based on the results of most recent environmental assessment.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Environmental assessment work is currently in progress (soil, groundwater, and surface water sampling) with the objective of understanding any potential risk to receptors and delineating the extent of the released material. Currently available data does not show a risk to the surface water body to the east. The need for clean-up work to mitigate environmental risk will be determined based on the results of most recent environmental assessment.
Annual Update Description Of Changes:
Description of remedial activities completed and in progress and their outcomes to date:
In response to the abovementioned flowline release, a number of assessment and remedial activities were completed in 2020. The objective of this work was to characterize the released material, delineate the impacted area, and manage risk to identified environmental receptors (surface water body to the east). 

An initial soil assessment program was conducted via hand auger immediately following the release. The results of this program were used to inform a supplementary assessment program, which involved using a drill rig to collect soil samples and install monitoring wells. Groundwater and surface water samples were also collected as part of this program. An excavation was conducted at the location of the flowline failure.

Chloride and electrical conductivity (EC) were used as soil indicator parameters to assess the extent of the release. The release location contains known pre-existing historical hydrocarbon impacts. Analysis of the soil sampling results (from the initial and supplementary environmental assessments) showed some migration of the released material along the flowline corridor, with limited lateral movement away from the flowline. Locations where elevated chloride and EC were detected in soil were largely removed during the excavation at the release location. 

Limited groundwater data was able to be collected from newly installed wells. Collected chloride and hydrocarbon data did not exceed applied CCME criteria. Surface water samples were collected from four locations along the surface water body to the east. Hydrocarbons were not detected in any of these samples.  Chloride concentrations were consistent across the sampling locations (including one up-gradient location) and did not indicate changes in water quality attributable to the spill.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities:
Planned remedial activities including an anticipated timeline:
In 2021, Imperial plans to delineate potential impacts along the flowline corridor by collecting soil samples to the north and south of the release location. Imperial also plans to conduct a groundwater and surface water monitoring program. Groundwater wells in the vicinity of the release location and the surface water body to the east of the release location will be sampled twice in 2021. 

Planned development of reports (e.g., remedial action plan, risk management plan, closure report) and justification for the report being developed, including a timeline for report submission to the CER:
An assessment report on the abovementioned 2021 activities will be prepared and submitted to the CER following the field execution and data analysis. At this time, next steps will be evaluated. Due to the operating infrastructure in the vicinity of the release and the pre-existing historical impacts, a risk management approach is expected to be the most appropriate strategy for managing residual impacts associated with this release.

Company Name: AltaGas Holdings Inc. for and on behalf of AltaGas Pipeline Partnership
Contaminated Site Description: The 13-6-104-12 W6M riser site consists of a 12” pig receiving header, bypass and an additional 8" flow line riser.
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC) other than BTEX
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: site is located in a very remote area.  Impacts are minimal and no adverse effects are expected.  impact has been left until such time as we can access the site and remove the impact during abandonment of the line, risers and meter station.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Impacts will be removed during abandonment of the pipeline.  impacts will be removed via excavation, confirmed clean via samples and laboratory analysis, back filled with clean fill and topsoil's replaced.  Impacted soils will be hauled to an appropriate class 2 landfill and disposed of accordingly.
Annual Update Description Of Changes:
The contaminated area was identified during a Phase 2 Environmental Site Assessment (ESA) completed by Prospect Environmental and reported on September 29, 2020. A Notice of Contamination was submitted by Altagas on September 8, 2020. Laboratory analytical results for the soil samples collected from within the area of concern during the Phase 2 ESA indicated concentrations of petroleum hydrocarbons (F3 and F4) and methanol that exceeded the applicable Alberta Tier 1 soil remediation guidelines.
As the riser site is located within an area of caribou and grizzly bear habitat and the work was planned to fall within the restricted activity period for caribou, a wildlife sweep was completed prior to initiating the planned remediation and abandonment work. A sample of impacted material was collected during the
wildlife sweep on February 17, 2021 for landfill analysis.
Two rounds of soil remediation with associated confirmatory sampling were completed at the site between February 26 and February 29, 2021.
Once it was confirmed that all impacted material had been removed, with the receipt of clean confirmatory laboratory analytical results, the excavated area was backfilled. As the riser site is located adjacent to a wetland area with organic soils present only a small amount of clay was backfilled in the excavation. The remainder of the excavation was loosely backfilled with clean sawdust and surrounding organic material to ensure the contour was blended and consistent with the adjacent land.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities:
No further remediation work is required.
Ongoing monitoring will occur based on the abandonment approval order and reporting will be compiled, and submitted, after the first, third and fifth growing season after abandonment activities being completed.  CER should expect the first report late in 2021, 2023 and final report in 2025.
If ongoing monitoring identifies any anomalies in the reclamation objectives then additional work to repair the area will be completed.

Response to IR 1 (incident review):
The spill area where the oil was released and contained is shown in Figure 1 and 9 in the DIR and the attached TetraTech EBA Figure 1 and 2. The release was cleaned up immediately by hydroexcavating visually impacted soil during the emergency response
phase of the cleanup from 1 to 3 December 2013 (DIR section 4.10). All free product associated with this release was contained
and collected immediately. Excavated impacted hydrovac slurry was hauled to an approved facility for disposal. Confirmatory
samples were collected from the remaining excavation to assess hydrocarbon concentrations. Analytical results indicated that
limited hydrocarbon impacts exceeding the applicable Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment (CCME) guidelines
remained on the floor and east wall of the excavation. Further excavation was not carried out due to the proximity of surrounding
infrastructure and the remaining impacts are being monitored through the existing groundwater monitoring program at the site.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Remaining contamination is being monitored through the existing groundwater monitoring program.

Contaminated Site Description: Historic third-party (Third-Party) contamination was identified on the TransCanada PipeLines Limited (TransCanada) NPS 42 Line 100-4 right-of-way (ROW) near the abandoned Third-Party pipeline.
Other Regulator Notifed: The Third Party that owns the abandoned pipeline reported the contamination to Saskatchewan Ministry of Energy and Resources
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con:
TransCanada retained a third-party environmental consultant to complete a soil investigation at the site. Soil samples were collected on 16 and 17 October 2018. Analytical results indicated petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC), polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH), and benzene and ethylbenzene exceedances of applicable provincial and federal criteria. 

TransCanada has removed some contaminated soil from the dig location and disposed of it at an appropriate facility.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: TransCanada is working with the Third Party to continue investigation activities in an effort to delineate the extent of the contamination. On site work is tentatively scheduled to resume in spring of 2019.
Annual Update Description Of Changes: In 2020, completed soil delineation of the historic Third-party contamination associated with an abandoned Third-party pipeline.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: No work is planned in 2021.

Contaminated Site Description: Hydrocarbon contamination at Edmonton Terminal located in vicinity of Manifold 206, associated with Line 2.
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: All visible free phase hydrocarbons have been removed via hydro-excavation.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Assessing the possibility of removing readily accessible hydrocarbon impacted soil exceeding Management Limits to reduce the hydrocarbon footprint at Edmonton Terminal.
Annual Update Description Of Changes: Partial remediation completed via excavation.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: Groundwater sampling as part of Edmonton Terminal Monitoring.

Contaminated Site Description: Hydrocarbon contamination within the Right-of-Way adjacent to the valve at 529.4.
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con:
Soil was excavated to a depth of 3.6m with a length and width of 7m and 3m, respectively. Confirmatory soil sampling from the excavation walls and base were below guidelines.

Visually impacted soil was excavated and disposed of off-site at a licensed facility.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: An Environmental Site Assessment will be conducted to the west of the 2018 excavated area to evaluate current concentrations of hydrocarbons in the area of the residual contamination identified in 2005 near the temporary roadway.
Annual Update Description Of Changes: File review completed for closure applicability based on previous remediation.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: No action required. Site has been remediated. Closure process to be initiated.

Contaminated Site Description: Small area of surficial staining identified at the abandoned riser location, no equipment remains.
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con:
As of September 29, 2020, staining was manually removed by Secure Onsite Services.  Approx. 25 kgs of hydrocarbon impacted soil was removed and disposed of in a Secure soil disposal bin.  A confirmatory sample was obtained from the excavated area on November 6, 2020.  Analysis indicated all hydrocarbon parameters were less than Alberta Tier 1 guidelines. The remediated footprint was extremely small and the vegetation is expected to naturally recover.

The remediation timelines were in compliance with Order AO-002-ZO-B258-004-2019.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: No further actions are required.  Vegetation in the remediated area will assessed along with the rest of the pipeline ROW in accordance with the conditions outlined in the Abandonment Order (in years 1, 3 and 5 following abandonment).

Contaminated Site Description: 66.5 m3 of crude oil was released from a valve on the site and dispersed by wind across the eastern portion of the site and onto the neighboring agricultural property. Developed Land – Industrial.  Surrounding neighboring property is Agricultural Land.
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: Contaminated soil was removed from the site and offsite. Impacted vegetation on the neighboring agricultural properties was mowed and disposed of offsite to remove the contaminants of concerns.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Impacted soil and vegetation has been removed on and off site. Monitoring is planned to assess vegetation regrowth on the neighbouring properties in 2021.

Contaminated Site Description: Two cubic metres (2 m3) of condensate was released from valve 13-V-1 in the southeast portion of Cactus Lake Station.  Refer to INC2020-005 for initial OERS entry.
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)

Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: No remediation activities are planned at this time.

Contaminated Site Description: The contaminated soil was encountered in the storage yard area during trench excavation activities on the east side of Burnaby Terminal.  Burnaby files include REM-0083, REM-0083b and REM-0303.
Contaminants at the Site: Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: Impacted soil was removed from the excavation trench and segregated into a soil pile.  Soil sampling was completed of the stockpiled soil and from within the base of the excavation trench.  Workers were notified that contamination had been encountered.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Limited assessment of the impacts were carried out during the trench excavation activities.  Trans Mountain plans to complete a soil assessment program to further determine the extents of the impacts.
Annual Update Description Of Changes: No further remediation activities are planned for this location.  A file closure request was filed with the CER on January 8,  2020.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: Trans Mountain awaits a response from the CER.

Contaminated Site Description: Hydrocarbon impacted soil discovered during a Line 13 integrity dig at MP 532.83. Petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC) and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) parameters were identified above regulatory guidelines. Enbridge does not have a record of a release at this location.
Contaminants at the Site: Petroleum Hydrocarbons (PHC);Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAH);Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylenes (BTEX)
Summary of Actions Taken to Mitigate Con: Impacted soil was segregated and will be disposed of at an approved landfill facility.
Summary of Actions Planned to Mitigate C: Additional environmental site assessment (ESA) activity will be initiated in 2019 to determine the extent of impacts. Following the completion of the ESA, if required, a Remedial Action Plan (RAP) will be submitted to the NEB for approval.
Annual Update Description Of Changes: Groundwater monitoring completed.
Annual Update Summary Of Activities: Evaluation of remedial options in 2021.
